name: NSRange
desc: A structure used to describe a portion of a series, such as characters in a string or objects in an array.

items.name: func NSEqualRanges(NSRange, NSRange) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two given ranges are equal.

items.name: func NSIntersectionRange(NSRange, NSRange) -> NSRange
items.desc: Returns the intersection of the specified ranges.

items.name: func NSLocationInRange(Int, NSRange) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a specified position is in a given range.

items.name: func NSMakeRange(Int, Int) -> NSRange
items.desc: Creates a new NSRange from the specified values.

items.name: func NSMaxRange(NSRange) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the sum of the location and length of the range.

items.name: func NSRangeFromString(String) -> NSRange
items.desc: Returns a range from a textual representation.

items.name: func NSStringFromRange(NSRange) -> String
items.desc: Returns a string representation of a range.

items.name: func NSUnionRange(NSRange, NSRange) -> NSRange
items.desc: Returns the union of the specified ranges.

items.name: typealias NSRangePointer
items.desc: Type indicating a parameter is a pointer to an NSRange structure.

items.name: let NSNotFound: Int
items.desc: A value indicating that a requested item couldn’t be found or doesn’t exist.
